name: Successfully Created User Account (Encrypted Text Password Allowed Enabled)
description: This rule triggers an alert when the Encrypted Text Password Allowed Enabled flag is set for a newly created user account. By default, this flag should not be enabled for accounts created through the “Active Directory Users and Computers” snap-in, as it compromises password security by allowing the use of reversible encryption. An enabled flag may indicate a security misconfiguration or potential risk that needs to be addressed. Monitoring this field helps ensure that accounts are configured securely.
author: celeroon
